meanings.definition: (verb) to burst open or split apart
meanings.sent1: The ripe fruit dehisced, scattering seeds everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The flower dehisced, releasing its pollen into the air.
meanings.sent3: The overstuffed suitcase dehisced, spilling clothes all over the airport floor.
meanings.sent4: The dam finally dehisced, unleashing a torrent of water downstream.
meanings.sent5: The balloon dehisced with a loud pop, startling everyone nearby.

meanings.definition: (adjective) open or split apart, as in a wound or seed pod
meanings.sent1: The dehisced wound needed immediate medical attention.
meanings.sent2: The dehisced seed pod revealed the hidden seeds inside.
meanings.sent3: The dehisced book cover flapped open in the breeze, revealing its contents.
meanings.sent4: The dehisced door swung open with a creak, inviting guests inside.
meanings.sent5: The dehisced nut shell lay empty on the forest floor, its contents gone.
